line.comment: * SCRIPT NAME: Renegades.Task.Renegade.xml
* DESCRIPTION: Provides logic for a Renegade
* Note, that if the ship is spawned in the Renegades home sector, the ship does nothing but patrol looking for player ships, and
* does nothing else, and does not drop a bunch of loot or clues.
* AUTHOR: Mr Mordan
* DATE: 29 February 2024
* Main Loop
* double scan range if we're going after a player sector, or if we're in the renegade home sector.
* Renegades.Task.Station will periodically send out it's owned renegade ships to invade a player sector by setting this local var on the ship.
* This happens in waves, once the player opens the renegades main sector gate. This will force a chunk of ships to go to
* random player sectors and wreak havok.
* Once we reach a certain stage, the renegades will actively come at the player rather than hanging around in a remote system.
* Note, it chooses a random player sector, not just the closest.
* Find a player sector.
* go there. If attacked along the way, resume
* got there, now announce to the player, unless we're doing an invasion, and then we don't need a dozen voices screaming at the player.

line.text: 'A Renegade has slipped by you and is targeting ships in '

line.comment: * If we're in the renegade sector, then we are defending the station and just kill any playership we can find and continue onto the next.
* this can be interrupted if the ship local variable "seekplayer" gets set by the Renegades.Task.Station, which is sending this ship out to attack the player.
* move to another spot in sector within roughly 20k. This results in a lot of stops and thus a lot of scans
* First try to find any satellites in the entire system, unless we're seeking in a player sector, in which case we want to kill ships only.
* No sat found, so look for player ships.
* Look for ships within scanner range.
* if explorer or a tug, ignore it. It's likely we can't catch it anyway.
* We can go for looters, but many of them are very fast. Lets check their speed and ignore them if they are faster than us.
* Attack any TL, TS, TP, M3 or satellites. Only attack larger ships if we are flying an M6 (hard level)
* Cool audio here.. Pirate laughing or other insulting taunt. (id's 11000-11006 are pre-audiio)

line.text: 'A Renegade has found your satellite in sector '
'A crazed Renegade has targeted your ship '

line.comment: * go kill.. KILL !
* 75% chance the renegade will stay in the remote system if we killed a satellite and not a ship.
* We're done attacking whatever target we found or we didn't want to attack it.
* Flee to the nearest valid station and disappear. Another will respawn soon.
* now destroy ourselves.
* Prevent any attacks on us from making us stop and fight. We are cowards. Filthy yellow cowards. Acted on in !ship.signal.attacked.xml
* find the closest station.
* It's odd, but sometimes the list of stations returns an Unknown object.. It exists, but can't be docked at, so we move on. No idea what it is.
* write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Found an undockable station: %s.', $station, null, null, null, null
* Outposts have restrictions that prevent any non-trader from another race from docking, so move on to somewhere else.
* write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Found a restricted station: %s.', $station, null, null, null, null
* Go there.
* write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Renegade Docked at %s', $closestStation, null, null, null, null
* should never get here, but if it does, I want to know.

line.text: 'Renegade in %s did NOT Dock at %s. CanDock = %s'

sval.val: is moving to player sector
A Renegade has slipped by you and is targeting ships in
Renegade ship found Target: %s in system %s
Renegade ship found Target:
in system
and is attacking
A Renegade has found your satellite in sector
A crazed Renegade has targeted your ship
in sector
Done Destroying Renegade
Finding nearest station for Renegade %s
Nearest station found for Renegade %s: %s
Moving Renegade to dock at
Renegade in %s did NOT Dock at %s. CanDock = %s
SCRIPT NAME: Renegades.Task.Renegade.xml
DESCRIPTION: Provides logic for a Renegade
Note, that if the ship is spawned in the Renegades home sector, the ship does nothing but patrol looking for player ships, and
does nothing else, and does not drop a bunch of loot or clues.
AUTHOR: Mr Mordan
DATE: 29 February 2024
Main Loop
double scan range if we're going after a player sector, or if we're in the renegade home sector.
Renegades.Task.Station will periodically send out it's owned renegade ships to invade a player sector by setting this local var on the ship.
This happens in waves, once the player opens the renegades main sector gate. This will force a chunk of ships to go to
random player sectors and wreak havok.
Once we reach a certain stage, the renegades will actively come at the player rather than hanging around in a remote system.
Note, it chooses a random player sector, not just the closest.
Find a player sector.
go there. If attacked along the way, resume
got there, now announce to the player, unless we're doing an invasion, and then we don't need a dozen voices screaming at the player.
If we're in the renegade sector, then we are defending the station and just kill any playership we can find and continue onto the next.
this can be interrupted if the ship local variable "seekplayer" gets set by the Renegades.Task.Station, which is sending this ship out to attack the player.
move to another spot in sector within roughly 20k. This results in a lot of stops and thus a lot of scans
First try to find any satellites in the entire system, unless we're seeking in a player sector, in which case we want to kill ships only.
No sat found, so look for player ships.
Look for ships within scanner range.
if explorer or a tug, ignore it. It's likely we can't catch it anyway.
We can go for looters, but many of them are very fast. Lets check their speed and ignore them if they are faster than us.
Attack any TL, TS, TP, M3 or satellites. Only attack larger ships if we are flying an M6 (hard level)
Cool audio here.. Pirate laughing or other insulting taunt. (id's 11000-11006 are pre-audiio)
go kill.. KILL !
75% chance the renegade will stay in the remote system if we killed a satellite and not a ship.
We're done attacking whatever target we found or we didn't want to attack it.
Flee to the nearest valid station and disappear. Another will respawn soon.
now destroy ourselves.
Prevent any attacks on us from making us stop and fight. We are cowards. Filthy yellow cowards. Acted on in !ship.signal.attacked.xml
find the closest station.
It's odd, but sometimes the list of stations returns an Unknown object.. It exists, but can't be docked at, so we move on. No idea what it is.
write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Found an undockable station: %s.', $station, null, null, null, null
Outposts have restrictions that prevent any non-trader from another race from docking, so move on to somewhere else.
write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Found a restricted station: %s.', $station, null, null, null, null
Go there.
write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Renegade Docked at %s', $closestStation, null, null, null, null
should never get here, but if it does, I want to know.
